title: Temple
review: A must visit...Hanuman temple.Take blessings of Lord Hanuman. The Idol is very huge and majestic.Awesome

title: Good temple with huge idols
review: This is on Road temple with good clean temple. Nice place and good cleanliness with good views. Ok if you skip this place

title: Huge Hanuman statue
review: Nice temple on the bank of the lake. The Hanuman statue is huge and the temple is well maintained with a lovely view.

title: Jai Hanuman Baba
review: Big, clean and scenic temple of Hanuman ji. One of the prominent place to visit near Naukuchiatal Lake. It has a huge Hanumanji statute which is its main attraction. Adjoining Vaishno Mata temple is also nice to visit. Road is very narrow near the temple so parking space is a bit less in front of the temple.

title: Peaceful
review: Its a small temple near the market.  Since naukuchital doesn't have  market, this is the place where you can get some handy snacks to munch.

title: Nice temple
review: Nice and clean temple in the middle of naukuchiatal city. Hanuman statue is vary nice. There is maa vaishnodevi cave as well here.

title: Stalwart Hanuman ji, Beautiful views!
review: The temple is conveniently located on the way to Naukuchiatal and is also close to Bhimtal market. It has a 52 ft tall statue of Lord Hanuman which looks beautiful with the landscape in the backdrop. It is also known as the Hanuman Garhi. There are a few local souvenir shops just in front of the temple.

title: Okay place
review: Just an okay place, visit only if you have time. It’s on the way to Naukachital and is situated on the lake

title: Awstruck
review: Had visited the Hanuman temple at naukuchital. It was very peaceful and the main attraction of the temple was the idol of lord hanuman. It was very huge.

title: Nie temple on the way to Naukuchiatal
review: Nie temple on the way to Naukuchiatal. It has a very big statue of lord hanuman and wont take more than 10 minutes of your time.

title: a very average temple
review: there is nothing special about it ... a local temple for worshipping... that too modernly built ... just a big statue of god hanuman

title: Beautiful temple
review: Lovely, clean temple on the side of a lazy road! Has a vaishno devi gufa (cave) as well. A separate durga temple allows elderly folks to have darshan without going through the gufa.

title: on the main road
review: temple is on the main road, the actual and ancient temple in naukuchiatal is 300 metres further on the lake.i find this a bit touristy, thought he dholpur stone is tastefully done, and a good view of the valley.

title: A very big idol of lord hanuman
review: It is a beautiful temple and a very big idol of hanuman is there. good for spiritual people and location of temple is also very good.

title: It's Busyness temple no worshiping
review: No asthetic in big statue in this temple ..all tourists vehicles parking at the temple gate

title: Good temple
review: This temple is situated on the way Naukuchital and near to Bhimtal.There also you have found one of Temple Complex with different gods are there.

title: quaint
review: The mandir is on the way to naukuchiatal and it was very prominent. We just saw it from out but a lot of school kids were visiting it.

title: Visited while stay in Naukuchiatal
review: Good to see once. Its on the way towards Naukuchiatal. The statue is 52 feet high on the hill top, those who are interested in temples should go inside and check out as we only took few snaps from outside

title: Hanuman Temple
review: The temple is very big and nice. It is very clean. The meditation hall is very good. Views are excellent from back side.

title: Visit to Hanuman Temple
review: Jai Hanuman!! This temple is located in Naukuchiatal just close to the Club Mahindra Resort where we stayed. On our way back to Delhi, we thought to have a quick darshan but ultimately spent almost an hour to adore the beauty of this temple. The view is exquisite from here and there is a cave for maa vaishno devi that gives a feel of Maa Vaishno Devi shrine in Katra. The temple was built in the 90s and hosts a place for meditation for a saint who kept silent for 62 years and promoted the fact that talking takes away major energy. The temple has beautiful sculptured of Mata Rani, a big statue of Hanuman ji, and cave of Maa Vaishno Devi. The trip was compete only after the visit there.

title: Hanuman
review: Hanuman is nicely built.Large Statue of deity is an attractive feature and bhool bulaiya below statue is also good experience.

title: Serene place with superb views
review: A place where you really feel the inner peace. Feel like sitting there for long time. Very hospitable and not crowded.

title: BEAUTIFUL TEMPLE by the side of the road and can not be missed
review: A very nice temple with a huge HANUMAN statue can be seen by the side of the road as we enter Naukuchiyatal, very calm and peaceful location and well maintained.   A Must visit.

title: Jai Sri Ram
review: Should visit in early morning or in evening. The tall murti of Lord Hanuman looks beautiful nested in the hills.

title: A hanuman templte
review: Nice hanuman temple nearby the lake. It has a manmade tunnel to give a look of a cave. It will take about 10 min to visit if you are in naukuchiatal. Not a must but can do if you have spare time

title: Nakuchiyatal Harum an temple
review: Had enjoyed wonderful experience for Nakuchiyatal hangman temple.  Nice Darshan of Bajarang bali also closed to this temple found Vaishnav Devi beautiful temple.  We had really enjoyed for that Darshan.

title: a small temple
review: A place of worship even when away from home.big sized Hanuman           Murti. Man ka Mandir. Some eating places oppo side.

title: A Must Visit Place in Naukuchiatal near Bhimtal.
review: There is a very beautiful temple with a very big Hanuman Ji, you really feel blessed here as the location of this temple is amazing, there are mountain range neighboring

title: Hanuman in hills
review: It was pleasure to visit Hanuman temple located few minutes away from Lake View resort where i was staying.

title: Well maintained, peaceful place
review: This temple is full of tourists brought in by their cabbies. It has Vaishno Devi Gufa, Tall Hanuman Pratima and a Mata Mandir side by side. Pretty clean place without any beggars. We visited early morning to enjoy listening to birds chirping.

title: Hanuman Temple is run by a Trust
review: The temple is managed by a trust doing some good work in helping the Pahadi kids. The huge statue of Hanuman is awesome and the priest is very kind.  We went a couple of times while we stayed in Naukuchiatal.

title: Temple on the way
review: Simple temple made as a tourist spot. There is nothing much to do around and the approach road is cramped. One can halt on the way to naukuchiatal

title: Jai bajrang bali
review: this temple offers a great sunset view and can be a great place to meditate and relax from your hectic schedule

title: Worship
review: As the name suggest to visit this place is Naukuchiatal or ‘lake of nine corners’ is a small beautiful hill station in Nainital district of the Indian state of Uttarakhand.

title: Imposing Temple
review: The towering idol of Lord Hanuman is a great sight for devotees. The 'gufa' leading to the Maa Sherawali Temple reminds of the 'gufa' in the Vaishnodevi Temple.

title: Jai Hanuman
review: This temple is in between Bhimtal and Naukuchiatal. The idol of God Hanuman is the main attraction. This place is a good place for meditation as it is less crowded.

title: nice
review: dont go there post 6 pm as it is dark and there is no street lights on the road and it is lonely plus temple is closed

title: Beautiful Temple
review: This is a beautiful temple on the way to Naukuchiatal from Bhimtal. You will not miss the imposing statue in this temple.

title: Huge Hanuman
review: You will see the very huge hanuman statue from the road itself. I think this the only main temple to visit around this area.

title: Peaceful location
review: Feeling cannot be expressed in words about the darshan of this mandir. Just can say a must visit for everyone whosoever staying in Bhimtal, Naukuchiyatal during their vacations.

title: A nice place to just roam around..
review: Take a round of the temple.. about 300 meters from Club Mahindra and about 1 Km from Naukuchiatal. I was staying in Club Mahindra the temple was a natural choice for me to visit. A nice small temple with nothing extra special or famous about it.

title: Awe inspiring Hanumanji!
review: A short walk downhill from Club Mahindra,Naukuchia tal we chanced upon this gigantic Hanumanji statue against the backdrop of green hills with  lake in distance!Awestruck! the temple houses other deities as well . very serene premises.

title: Very calm and scenic
review: Just by the lake, a very beautiful temple with huge space yet not crowded. I remember spending a lot time sitting on bench there with an eye catching scenic view.

title: Scenic.. Divine...Must visit...
review: This temple is on the way to  Naukuchiya Tal and another at around 3.5 km from Nainital on the way from Delhi to Nainital. This temple is on the road between Bhim Tal and Navkuchiya Tal. Situated on the road and eye catching due to the very big around 40 ft high Hanumanji idol. The place is scenic with a beautiful view of hills. The temples are situated in two floors. Few temples are directly on the road floor and few are one floor below. A artificial cave is created to get down to the Paduka of Hanumanji; also a Vaishno Devi temple below. Do not forget to visit Radha Krishna temple for which you have to climb up 10-15 steps. This temple is serene and with a big podium. Seat there, close your eyes and meditate for few minutes.  Overall its a must visit temple when you visit Nainital.

title: Hanuman ji towering over you
review: The temple is close to the Club Mahindra resort, within walking distance, so the two of us, my husband and I, walked down. From the outside we had not realized that it is so huge. There are a number of temples underground, a replica of Mata Vaishno Devi temple, Lord Krishna and Radha, and a Shiva temple. On the way back, a monkey was blocking our way, so we had to wait until it walked away. The complex is peaceful and spiritual. Near the exit, there is a Navagraha temple, and a lady was praying to Lord Sani (it was a Saturday).

title: Went for some blessings and next to para gliding adventure
review: Nice beautiful place to visit temple is well maintained went for blessing and karma, innovation used in making some parts of temple, beautiful place in lap of mountains, next to adventure sports loction, enjoyed and felt blessed

title: Hanuman temple in forest surroundings
review: Very clean,well laid out temple, which evokes respect for the God just by entering the premises. Small but very well kept.The surroundings are ideal for a Hanuman temple.Must see for visitors to nainital.

title: Nice peaceful temple
review: well maintained, peaceful and comfortably located. A must visit even for leisure if not spirituality.

title: Calm and Divine
review: On the Lake tour itinerary from Nainital comes Hanuman Temple. This temple is close to Bhimtal and Naukuchiatal. If you have taken a Lake tour than you should definitely visit this temple. The atmosphere here is very divine and quiet. You will surely enjoy this visit.

title: Huge statue of Hanuman
review: Close to Naukchaital lake, one of the sight seeing points. A huge hanuman statue and the place is well kept. its right on the road so entering and exiting is a little problem as the traffic always jams up there..

title: Very nice and peaceful temple near Naukchaital lake.
review: This temple is very near (walkable distance) to Club Mahindra resort and Naukchaital lake. A very calm and nice place with a huge idol of Lord Hanuman.

title: Huge lord Hanumana Statue
review: loved this temple, it's enroute the lake resort. Do stop by and you may be handed over a test to answer also. It was really good.

title: Superb location
review: Nice well maintained temple at a amazing location. Very peaceful and calm. Beware of monkeys. Very good view

title: Great vibes
review: Very nice temple with huge hanumanji. Its nicely made and worth a visit for darshan.  There is also Durga ma's idol.

title: Hanumanji
review: The Tall hanuman stands towering  over you and is peaceful place to Pray , The temple stand in front o a background of the lake town and provided a perfect ambience to pray among the vacation

title: Wow
review: On the road side ..Gigantic and lively. The idol and the temple is maintained very well. Went there at least  twice during our stay

title: NIce and peaceful
review: Naukuchiatal is anyway a less crowded place, and this temple is same except some festivals. nice place to visit.

title: Beautiful but extremely loud temple
review: This temple has a very large statue of Hanuman ji. It is quite clean with plenty of open areas. The only concern is the extremely loud loud speakers which the temple has. They play excruciatingly loud bhajans all day long. They shatter the peaceful surrounding and make it very difficult for people staying in close by hotels to enjoy peace.

title: Huge lord Hanuman
review: Nice well maintained temple at a amazing location on the way to lake. Very peaceful and calm.nice view.

title: Devotional experience in Bhimtal
review: Temple is having huge high Hanuman statue and it's really gives good experience.

title: Spiritual !
review: Its a nice and well maintained ashram with a large statue of Lord Hanuman ! Located close to the Naukuchiataal lake and good place to visit.

title: Hanuman Temple - a good temple
review: This temple is bang behind the Hotel Spring Birds.One can hear the chantings all through the day from the hotel.The temple has a huge Hanuman statue just by the side of the temple Its a good place to visit has a dark tunnel to reach the God...

title: Very tall idol of Hanumanji
review: A very tall idol of Hanumanji greets you to Naukuchiatal. One should definitely visit the temple if you are staying in the area - very good and clean temple

title: Huge Pavan Putra
review: There is a huge idol of Lord Hanuman right at the centre of naukuchiatal, near the lake. Many tourist believe he is very powerful. Faith can move mountains, so do try visiting him :)

title: Tall Hanuman
review: Located near Naukuchiatal,the Hanuman temple ,is 52 feet tall,surrounded by mountains and valley. The main premises, comprises , resting/staying place for devotees, the meditation room, Ram Darbar temple, and the Shani Temple.

title: On the way visit
review: beautiful small temple on the way to Nakuchiatal lake, Huge Deity with beautiful nature all around. one cave temple visit must

title: serene and peaceful temple
review: very close to dancing waters resort of Club Mahindra at Naukuchiatal. It is a huge statue of Lord Hanuman and a photospot

title: Nice clean temple in good surroundings
review: Nice clean temple in good surroundings. Being where it is, it is not too commercialized. In all, our experience was satisfactory

title: Tall Hauman Idol
review: This temple is a beauty in the hills, having very tall hanuman idol just by the side of main road. These is a vaisno mata mandir cave also in the temple which is similar to the actual cave. Nice clean must watch temple.

title: A nice temple nestled in Nature's lap
review: A tall idol of Hanumanji grabs your attention when you are going to Naukuchiyatal lake from Nainital. A quite place surrounded by natural beauty of Himalayan mountain range which gives you solace. A good place to feel connected with your religious belief.

title: Divine!
review: Being a deity of lord hanuman, i could feel the divinity arouse. Not very commercialized,   not too crowded. I was spellbound looking at the huge statue of lord hanuman. There is maa vaishno devi guha as well.

title: Halt there for its scenic beauty
review: It is huge idol with its back towards the valley. This gives it a scenic beauty. You will find it on the way to Naukuchiatal. Apart from its religious value, there is hardly anything for which you would like to spend time there. Yes, just in front of the temple are some shops and also a small restaurant by the name of Sri Balaji Kitchen. You may like to stop here for some good food. This also gives you an opportunity to enjoy the scenic beauty.

title: Jai Hanuman Gyan Gun Sagar.
review: Peace tranquility love. Ram Ram.

title: awsum
review: this was a gr88888 temple and food shops opposite to it were also gr8888. so it was awsum and it is very near to cm naukuchiatal

title: OK to visit if in this area
review: OK to visit this temple if visiting in and around Naukutchiatal. Not a place for which one need to plan a specific visit.

title: Temple by the road
review: As you enter Naukuchiatal you would find the Hanuman temple on the right hand side.  A distinct feature of the temple is the giant Hanuman statute and a tableau. Quiet, serene rejuvenating experience for the soul.

title: HUGE HANUMAN STATUE
review: Hanuman presides over the route to the Club Mahindra resort and the Lake. His majestic figure is inspiring.... There is also a Vaishnodevi type cave for the Devi. Views from the temple are fabulous

title: A place of worship
review: A very tall statue of Hanuman Jee greets you when you go up from Bhimtaal to Naukuchiataal. A beautiful and big temple is the land-mark of that place and a guiding factor for the locals and visitors alike. Advisable to take blessing from Hanuman jee before going ahead.

title: Peaceful, well located and Huge.
review: The giant Hanuman idol is something of  a landmark in Naukuchiaataal.

title: Spirituality
review: Nibkrori Babaji has layed the foundation of this temple.Good reastaurent in front of mandir.Can have tea there.Walking distance from Club Mahindra resort.

title: beautiful!
review: Though i could not go inside the temple as it was on our way to Naukuchiatl,one needs to go specially to visit this temple. I would recommend that you either take a driver who could drop you and park the car or walk to it  as the road is quite narrow. This temple is on the way to Naukuchiatal from bhimtal with a very big Hanuman ji's Murti.

title: Magnificent!
review: The temple is located on bhimtal naukuchiatal road. You just can't miss it as there is a huge & magnificently built statute of Lord Hanuman. The temple is beautifully made & maintained. The area is very clam & serene. Definitely, not to be missed!!!

title: Jai Hanuman
review: This Hanuman Temple is a must visit if you are visiting BhimTal/NaukuchiaTal... The Temple is a small and peacefull place with a BIG idol of Lord Hanuman overlooking the road in front. This place is not very crowded and one can find mental peace here.

title: Awesome.
review: Well maintained and very serene...

title: Blessed!
review: The ghanta mandir is one of the must-see places here. Beware of the monkeys though, quite agressive if you have food in your hands!!

title: Large Hanuman temple
review: A fairly large deity. Nothing special about the temple.

title: Calm and peaceful place
review: The temple is located on the main road but is having amazing design and perfect view from its roof. The statue of Lord Hanuman is big to get a view from far also

title: Nice quiet temple
review: Went here on the way back from The Lake Village, Naukuchiatal.

title: Nice Pictorial View
review: Very nicely landscaped temple. Enjoy good scenic view from here. Very nice place to click good pictures in your camera.

title: Jai Hanumanji
review: The temple was closed by the time we reached, but I stopped on my way back from Naukuchiatal to take pics of this giant Hanuman structure

title: Giant Statue of Hanuman Ji
review: Very giant statue of Bajrang Bali is the main attraction of this temple. There is one cave replicating the cave of Vaishno Devi Temple in Katra. Temple is very clean.

title: Huge statue of Hanuman
review: Nice, clean temple, awesome view from the temple terrace, impressive huge statue of the God Hanuman. Enjoyed the bells ringing when religious activities took place in the temple.

title: well maintained temple
review: its a nice temple in middle of a narrow street on bhimtal road.
